H0.text: Selective breeding is a consequence of a student failing to eat a balanced diet over a period of time.

H1.text: Dynamic equilibrium can result from a student failing to eat a balanced diet over a period of time.

H2.text: Extinction can result from a student failing to eat a balanced diet over a period of time.

H3.text: Disease can result from a student failing to eat a balanced diet over a period of time.

A4.text: Malnutrition was previously seen as something that exacerbates the problems of diseases such as measles, pneumonia and diarrhea, but malnutrition actually causes diseases, and can be fatal in its own right.
